item.title: Bin containing Asbestos in Mason Close Alley., 20th October
item.description:
A bin has been dumped in a Mason Close alleyway which appears to contain Asbestos. As this is a health and safety issue. Could you please deal with this as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pelham Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Leaf clearance, 20th October
item.description:
A resident has asked us to bring to your attention that when clearing leaves from the edge of kerbs, they are often moved by the machine into clumps a short distance and parallel to the kerb. The machine does not then go back to pick these up. This example in photo is from Ashfield Lane but others such as Hawkwood Lane were also cited.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashfield Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rendezvous Caffe - Blocking Pavement, 20th October
item.description:
Rendezvous Caffe keep blocking the pavement to the flats behind the cafe with the table/chairs, planter and their customers illegal parking (in front the barrier), residents must then step into the road to go round these obstacles (accident waiting to happen) to get to theirs homes. Can you please contact the cafe and address this issue by verifying the boundaries of their pavement license.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86-90, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks dumped on road, 20th October
item.description:
The same issue was reported around 5 weeks ago multiple times and was ignored by the council. This waste is blocking the road and making it difficult for cars to pass each other. I am happy to keep on reporting the issue until it is properly resolved.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Steel bollard protecting the pavement from vehicles damaged, 20th October
item.description:
Last week a Tesco branded delivery vehicle exiting the shop service yard accessed from Park Hall Road struck and partly uprooted this bollard. The bollard is intended to prevent vehicles from cutting corners across the pavement. It is leaning towards the road so if it falls it will fall into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Hall Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
